content: Best editor I've found but that doesn't mean much. I got this for on the go coding but it is quite annoying to use with gboard. Eg when the editor regains focus if a key besides 1 of in-app arrows is pushed first, the current line is jumbled or duped 5x needing 90 undos to fix. Other cons are high power usage (26%/6h on my S10 that can easily get 12h sot per 80%) and a "regex" search option that doesn't even support unflagged noncapture groups. Looking forward to a fix so I add these last 2 ‚òÖ‚òÖ.
Overal. I give 10 ‚≠ê for Acode. If you can, next update. It very helpful when it can change keyboard and have auto indent..üòÅ Rest of it. I love this apps
Ok I just found that search function. it should be on menu as well. great code editor btw'..
replyContent: There is search option in bottom bar. Or press ctrl+f to search.

content: I evaluated several high-rated IDE's. Acode was the winner. It has many convenient features such as Emmett (use shorthand to generate html elements), a quick-actions bar with copy line, move line and more, and it has a ton of keyboard shortcuts. It also supports word wrap. Acode doesn't hide your files in impenetrable "projects" like one of the other apps. I enjoy using it. It's well thought out, mature, and has all the features I hoped for. It is worth well more than the $3.99 I paid for it
replyContent: Thanks for your review! Please recommend our app to your friends, and don‚Äôt hesitate to shoot us a note at acode@foxdebug.com if you have any questions.
